messages: 273b79ac2d0d1e9dd5857cbc7fb8b28a (13:38): Can I make changes to the files in omni.ja and have firefox pick it up?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (13:40): 273b79ac2d0d1e9dd5857cbc7fb8b28a, if you unpack it and remove omni.ja, it should work
27a00904c55e1a3947176eabe2c0f262 (13:41): though when you restart firefox, oyu may need to run it with -purgecache
273b79ac2d0d1e9dd5857cbc7fb8b28a (13:43): mozilla-central segfaults on me on my build.
273b79ac2d0d1e9dd5857cbc7fb8b28a (13:43): So I'm having to explore "other options"
27a00904c55e1a3947176eabe2c0f262 (13:44): i thought you figured that out?
273b79ac2d0d1e9dd5857cbc7fb8b28a (13:47): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: what do you mean by unpack?
27a00904c55e1a3947176eabe2c0f262 (13:47): ugh, its far too late at night for me to look at a stacktrace like that
273b79ac2d0d1e9dd5857cbc7fb8b28a (13:51): Did not find omni.ja and crashed.
273b79ac2d0d1e9dd5857cbc7fb8b28a (13:51): So, I may have done something wrong.
273b79ac2d0d1e9dd5857cbc7fb8b28a (13:52): So, it can't be run that way?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (13:56): <Jesse> mano: can't build, too much porn on my hd
ac8eed6d77b64d7bc2b0edc969a49197 (13:57): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: i started looking a bit into xpconnect
ac8eed6d77b64d7bc2b0edc969a49197 (13:57): and i am currently working on a patch to remove the includes of typedarray.h
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (13:58): strikes that off his todo list
ac8eed6d77b64d7bc2b0edc969a49197 (13:58): yes, this recent bug about type conversation interested me
ac8eed6d77b64d7bc2b0edc969a49197 (14:00): eg. i think  nsIDOMHTMLAudioElement::MozWriteAudio could now take an float32[] array as paramter
273b79ac2d0d1e9dd5857cbc7fb8b28a (14:00): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: What I'm finding suggests that you're right.
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (14:01): ac8eed6d77b64d7bc2b0edc969a49197, even if we want to support plain arrays?
ac8eed6d77b64d7bc2b0edc969a49197 (14:02): yes because from my understanding we would just convert every element to an float32 in that case
ac8eed6d77b64d7bc2b0edc969a49197 (14:05): going to fill a bug
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (14:05): Is that the right line number?
ac8eed6d77b64d7bc2b0edc969a49197 (14:06): not quite, but the POPULATE does that
ac8eed6d77b64d7bc2b0edc969a49197 (14:12): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: ah, not quite, looks like that in webidl you always need a size_is parameter
273b79ac2d0d1e9dd5857cbc7fb8b28a (14:22): Is the "firefox should work if omni.ja is extracted and deleted" case expected behavior? Can I file a bug about it not working.
273b79ac2d0d1e9dd5857cbc7fb8b28a (14:29): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: bug 707502, if you're interested in following.
b92af08a18aff623222629da14873ffd (14:31): wonders how to just ensure that configure is up-to-date without actually triggering a reconfigure if it isn't
3fe446bf43186a0a6ab70e26fba86a53 (14:41): 273b79ac2d0d1e9dd5857cbc7fb8b28a: when you unziped omni.ja did you tell it to replace chrome.manifest?
3fe446bf43186a0a6ab70e26fba86a53 (14:42): It will definitely crash if you tell it to leave the existing chrome.manifest
